intro: Ficus guajavoides, commonly known as the Guajaví tree, is a species of fig tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a broad, spreading canopy. The leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth texture and a dark green upper surface. It produces small, clustered figs that are typically green when mature, and it flowers in the summer months. This plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
